Consider the following program, and draw a diagram showing I bR T ) I (Yo o o S o =T T i ST o1 o) CSIT o g XYSP T [o IRVZ oTo (IR o1 o L KIT o ) o R X — For example, the C code: \\\c I #include <fcntl.h> | #include <unistd.h> int main(int argc, char skargv) { int fd_a = open("a.txt", O_RDONLY); // = 3 int fd_b = open("b.txt", O_RDONLY); pid_t child_pid = fork(); int fd_c; - int fd_d; if (child_pid > @) { // parent process only fd_c = open("c.txt", O_RDONLY); fd_d = dup(fd_c); } else if (child_pid == @) { // child process only fd_c = open("c.txt", O_RDONLY); fd_d = dup(fd_c); } return 0; } corresponds to the diagram
